Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Compo \Com"po\, n.; pl. {-pos}. Short for {Composition}; -- used, esp. in England, colloq. in various trade applications; as : (a) A mortar made of sand and cement. (b) A carver's mixture of resin, whiting, and glue, used instead of plaster of Paris for ornamenting walls and cornices. (c) A composition for billiard balls. (d) A preparation of which printer's rollers are made. (e) A preparation used in currying leather. (f) Composition paid by a debtor. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: POS Piece Of Shit (telecommunication-slang, Usenet, IRC)
